intro: Clarkia franciscana, commonly known as the San Francisco Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under the Endangered Species Act.
